metadata.title: USN-2675-1 -- LXC vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Roman Fiedler discovered that LXC had a directory traversal flaw when creating lock files. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to create an arbitrary file as the root user. (CVE-2015-1331)  Roman Fiedler discovered that LXC incorrectly trusted the container's proc filesystem to set up AppArmor profile changes and SELinux domain transitions. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to run programs inside the container that are not confined by AppArmor or SELinux. (CVE-2015-1334)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-2675-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  lxc-dev - 1.0.7-0ubuntu0.2 liblxc1 - 1.0.7-0ubuntu0.2 lxc-templates - 1.0.7-0ubuntu0.2 python3-lxc - 1.0.7-0ubuntu0.2 lxc - 1.0.7-0ubuntu0.2 lxc-tests - 1.0.7-0ubuntu0.2 No subscription required
